          <title>David Eimer and Bill Browder</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/david-eimer-and-bill-browder/6366962</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Mark Colvin talks to David Eimer, former Beijing correspondent with Britain’s Sunday telegraph about his book ‘The Emperor Far Away'. He wrote the book after travelling to more remote and less known parts of China.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <pubDate>Mon, 06 Apr 2015 17:05:00 +1000</pubDate>

    <item>
          <title>John Lanchester and John Kampfner</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/john-lanchester/6366942</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              The rich, the poor, and the language of money. In this current affairs special Mark Colvin talks to two commentators with money on their minds:  John Lanchester on how to speak money, and John Kampfner on the growing gap between global haves and have nots.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <pubDate>Fri, 03 Apr 2015 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/john-lanchester/6366942</guid>
          <category>Business, Economics and Finance</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Dr Atul Gawande</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/dr-atul-gawande/5979010</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              A gripping interview with one of the word’s most interesting doctors.  Eleanor Hall speaks to the author about his new book, covering the issues of ageing, dying and how to reform global healthcare.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Eleanor Hall</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Thu, 01 Jan 2015 05:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/dr-atul-gawande/5979010</guid>
          </item>
    <item>
          <title>Indigenous Diggers</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/indigenous-diggers/5978906</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              This documentary takes us behind the scenes in the push to properly recognise indigenous Australians who broke the rules when enlisting to fight for and serve their country. Journalist Nance Haxton attends ceremonies in local communities as well as in Brisbane as she documents the hurt felt by generations of Aboriginal Australians who were shunned and not properly recognised after having put their lives on the line for their nation.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Nance  Haxton</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Wed, 31 Dec 2014 05:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/indigenous-diggers/5978906</guid>
          </item>
    <item>
          <title>Kim Williams</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/kim-williams/5978852</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Eleanor Hall speaks to former News Corp Australia boss Kim Williams on his departure from Murdoch’s embrace and Australia’s media situation in general.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Eleanor Hall</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Tue, 30 Dec 2014 05:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/kim-williams/5978852</guid>
          </item>
    <item>
          <title>Schools Up</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/schools-up/5979272</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              SCHOOLS UP – a documentary by Natalie Whiting and introduced by Mark Colvin.  Natalie profiles the work being done in Adelaide at a school called Wiltja.  Indigenous Australians from the APY lands come to board at Wiltja so they can concentrate on their studies and break the cycle of truancy and dropping out of high school back in their own communities.  The piece seeks to explain what it is about the set up at Wiltja that turns young impressionable students into impressive school graduates.  It also answers the question about what happens to the graduates and can they make a positive difference when they return home.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Natalie Whiting</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Mon, 29 Dec 2014 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/schools-up/5979272</guid>
          <category>Access To Education</category>
            <category>Distance Education</category>
            <category>Secondary Schools</category>
            <category>Indigenous Culture</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Jonathan King</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/jonathan-king/5978732</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              One of Australia’s foremost military historians reflects on the ANZAC story again, using his research and interviews with veterans of World War 1.  Eleanor Hall speaks to Jonathan King about the book he’s written in the run-up to the centenary of Gallipoli in 2015.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Eleanor Hall</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Sat, 27 Dec 2014 07:10:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/jonathan-king/5978732</guid>
          </item>
    <item>
          <title>Peter Carey</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/peter-carey/5978586</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Mark Colvin talks to the author about his most recent book Amnesia, literature in general, publishing and life.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Mark Colvin</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Fri, 26 Dec 2014 05:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/peter-carey/5978586</guid>
          <category>Books (Literature)</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Clive James</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/clive-james/5978538</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Mark Colvin talks with Clive James about his lifelong love of poetry, as a critic and a practitioner and about how literature and music are his supports as he prepares for a death foretold.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Mark Colvin</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Thu, 25 Dec 2014 05:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/clive-james/5978538</guid>
          <category>Poetry</category>
            <category>Death</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Thomas Keneally</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/thomas-keneally/5977274</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Mark Colvin interviews the author Thomas Keneally who has written a history of the post war era talks about how the diggers came home from Europe to a land that was supposed to be fit for heroes, and how gradually the roaring 20s turned into the depression.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Mark Colvin</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Wed, 24 Dec 2014 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/thomas-keneally/5977274</guid>
          </item>
    <item>
          <title>Douglas Newton</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/douglas-newton/5977180</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Mark Colvin interviews the historian Douglas Newton about his ground-breaking book "Hell-Bent" which has radically changed the picture of how and why and even when Australian started planning to enter the First World War.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Mark Colvin</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Tue, 23 Dec 2014 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/douglas-newton/5977180</guid>
          <category>20th Century</category>
            <category>World War 1</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Domestic Violence</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/domestic-violence/5976994</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              This program examines why Australia has such stubbornly high rates of domestic violence, and the effort going into improving the situation.  The piece includes powerful face to face interviews with former Governor-General Quentin Bryce as well as with the families of victims and with police and counsellors.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Stephanie Smail</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Mon, 22 Dec 2014 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/domestic-violence/5976994</guid>
          </item>
    <item>
          <title>Prenatal screening revolution</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-prenatal/5159196</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Pregnancy is a journey of hope …. but it's also one of uncertainty. For more than a decade the standard prenatal screening and testing in Australia has remained largely unchanged. But 2013 heralded a scientific revolution in this area. A simple blood test now has the potential to give women more information than ever before.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Elizabeth Jackson</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Fri, 03 Jan 2014 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-prenatal/5159196</guid>
          <category>Pregnancy and Childbirth</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title> United Nations of Logan</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-logan27s-future/5159174</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              It's been dubbed  Queensland's new United Nations. Logan - just to the south of Brisbane in Queensland's south-east - is now one of the fastest growing urban corridors in Australia, with more than 200 different ethnic groups living in the region. Tensions between some of those cultural groups climaxed in  in January this year, attracting national media coverage as police were called in to quell street riots. But Logan's leaders say they want people to see the real city with it's strong community spirit, and big hopes for the future.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Elizabeth Jackson</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Thu, 02 Jan 2014 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-logan27s-future/5159174</guid>
          <category>Multiculturalism</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Fight for the right to fight</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-russia-lgbt/5159152</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Many countries, including Australia, are taking positive steps towards eliminating discrimination against gays and lesbians, especially in the area of marriage equality. Yet in Russia, events are taking a decidedly different turn. In June, the Russian government passed a law that banned the communication of information about homosexuality to minors, effectively making it illegal to present gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender people as equal to heterosexuals.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Elizabeth Jackson</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Wed, 01 Jan 2014 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-russia-lgbt/5159152</guid>
          <category>Gays and Lesbians</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Almost Sport Stars</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-almost-sportstars/5159132</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              They were gifted. From a young age, they stood out - on the field or court or track - whatever their chosen sport, surely they were destined for greatness.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Elizabeth Jackson</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Tue, 31 Dec 2013 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-almost-sportstars/5159132</guid>
          <category>Sport</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Starved for a Cure</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-starved-of-a-cure/5159108</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Christmas is supposed to be a time of joy and indulgence, but for many Australians suffering from eating disorders, it's torture. Every new year, many resolve to recover, very few achieve it. Navigating through a health system which is ill equipped and expensive, doesn't usually deliver the cure patients are looking for.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Elizabeth Jackson</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Mon, 30 Dec 2013 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-starved-of-a-cure/5159108</guid>
          <category>Eating Disorders</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>King-hit in Kings Cross</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-king-hit/5159086</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Thomas Kelly is now a household name in Sydney, 18 months after he died. He was one of the dozens of mostly young men who've been killed after being king hit during  a night out in the city. Despite their vast numbers, it's the case of Tom Kelly that seems to have been the trigger for change. Already there've been changes in Kings Cross, and the story is still unfolding.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Elizabeth Jackson</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Fri, 27 Dec 2013 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-king-hit/5159086</guid>
          <category>Alcohol</category>
            <category>Assault</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Three strikes evictions</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-wa-evictions/5159030</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              No-one likes bad neighbours, and WA’s hardline three strikes policy to evict troublesome public housing tenants is popular with residents keen to preserve tranquillity in their streets.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Elizabeth Jackson</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Thu, 26 Dec 2013 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-wa-evictions/5159030</guid>
          <category>Housing</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Restored choppers stir mixed memories</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3avietnam-choppers/5159004</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              The defining sound of the Vietnam War was a versatile helicopter nicknamed the "Huey".
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Elizabeth Jackson</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Wed, 25 Dec 2013 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3avietnam-choppers/5159004</guid>
          <category>Air Transport</category>
            <category>Defence Forces</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Kununurra street kids</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-kununurra/5158902</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              In a remote West Australian town, dozens of Aboriginal children spend their nights on the streets.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Elizabeth Jackson</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Tue, 24 Dec 2013 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-kununurra/5158902</guid>
          <category>Indigenous (Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander)</category>
            <category>Antisocial Behaviour</category>
            <category>Children</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>ICAC reveals farmers are vulnerable</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-farmers/5159296</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              The New South Wales Independent Commission Against Corruption has made some startling findings about politicians and mining leases in the Hunter Valley. Allegations of corruption aside, through it's investigations, the ICAC has revealed just how vulnerable people can be if they happen to live in an area which a mining company decides it wants.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Elizabeth Jackson</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Mon, 23 Dec 2013 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-farmers/5159296</guid>
          <category>Rural</category>
            <category>Mining (Rural)</category>
            <category>Mining Environmental Issues</category>
            <category>Mining Industry</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: Ok Tedi</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/ok-tedi/4434570</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              When BHP controlled it, the Ok Tedi mine site became a byword for environmental disaster.  But now that the PNG government has a large stake in the mine, the heat is on politicians to ensure that the mine makes money, creates jobs and safeguards the health of the areas around it.  Jemima Garrett visits Ok Tedi and speaks to all the important players, from the Prime Minister down.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Simon Santow</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Mon, 21 Jan 2013 06:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/ok-tedi/4434570</guid>
          <category>Mining Industry</category>
            <category>Mining Environmental Issues</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: More Than Anywhere Else</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-anywhere-else/4431972</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Your teenage years can often be an intense and angst-filled period. It’s the age when you’re challenged with the task of becoming an adult at a time when you feel most unsure of yourself.
In the Sydney inner-city suburb Waterloo, you can be faced with this task at a much earlier age. Waterloo and it’s neighbouring suburb of Redfern often hit the headlines for youth riots, drugs and domestic violence.
But beyond the headlines, what is it like to grow up there? What does it take to survive? And who do you turn to when it all falls apart?
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Simon Santow</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Mon, 14 Jan 2013 06:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-anywhere-else/4431972</guid>
          <category>Youth</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: Experimenting with Steroids</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/-experimenting-with-steroids/4431916</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              What is it that’s driving young men to use steroids?  This documentary examines the culture of young men taking shortcuts and turning to drugs to look good.  Tom Nightingale take listeners into the gym world where steroid use and concerns about body image among men are alarming psychologists and health experts.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Simon Santow</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Fri, 04 Jan 2013 17:10:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/-experimenting-with-steroids/4431916</guid>
          <category>Drug Use</category>
            <category>Exercise and Fitness</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: East Timor Future</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/-east-timor-future/4437748</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              10 years after independence, East Timor is at the crossroads.  As Australian troops leave town and debate rages over how to spend the resources income,  it’s a good opportunity to look at the fledgling nation’s future.  Sara Everingham has visited East Timor several times in the past year.  In this documentary she speaks to business people who can help chart the last decade and make predictions about the next.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Simon Santow</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Thu, 03 Jan 2013 17:10:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/-east-timor-future/4437748</guid>
          </item>
    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: Freedom</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-freedom/4431894</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              An 82 year old Tasmanian woman helps rehabilitate hardened criminals.  A chance meeting seven years ago convinced Elizabeth Coleman she could make a difference to prisoners struggling to adjust to freedom after serving their sentences.  Felicity Ogilvie takes listeners to a little farm in the Huon Valley where good deeds are done and lives put back on track.  Ex-prisoners tell their stories and an insight is gained into what can be achieved through rehabilitation, rather than throwing away the keys.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Simon Santow</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Wed, 02 Jan 2013 17:10:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-freedom/4431894</guid>
          <category>Prisons and Punishment</category>
            <category>Rehabilitation</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: Anatomy of a Kidnapping</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-anatomy-of-a-kidnapping/4431870</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              When international marriages break down the custody battle can be particularly vicious and also expensive.  In Japan the situation is complicated because the country stands out as the only Group of Eight industrialized nations not to have signed the Hague Convention.   As a result hundreds of abductions have taken place and lives have been destroyed.  The ABC has obtained exclusive access to the planning stages of an abduction to Japan.  Sarah Dingle takes us inside three separate tragedies and gives us an insight into the mind of an abductor in The Anatomy of a Kidnapping.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Simon Santow</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Tue, 01 Jan 2013 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-anatomy-of-a-kidnapping/4431870</guid>
          <category>Family Law</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: Digital Europe</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/digital-europe/4437732</link>
          <dc:creator>Simon Santow</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Mon, 31 Dec 2012 17:10:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/digital-europe/4437732</guid>

            <category>International Financial Crisis</category>
            <category>Small Business</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: Military Mind</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-military-mind/4434526</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Peter Lloyd looks at the problem of post traumatic stress disorder among Australian soldiers.  He profiles soldiers who have returned home and the impact their service has had on them and their families.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Simon Santow</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Fri, 28 Dec 2012 17:10:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-military-mind/4434526</guid>
          <category>Health</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: Surrogacy Secrets</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/surrogacy-secrets/4431846</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Paying a woman overseas to carry a child for you is a crime in three Australian states and territories, but, a growing number of Australians are choosing to flout surrogacy laws.   Barbara Miller investigates how federal authorities are granting citizenship and passports to babies born to surrogates, despite the fact it’s illegal.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Simon Santow</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Thu, 27 Dec 2012 17:10:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/surrogacy-secrets/4431846</guid>
          <category>Surrogacy</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: I Sit in Middle</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-i-sit-in-middle/4434512</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Two and a half years ago, Tony Windsor and Rob Oakeshott  were suddenly catapulted into the nation’s spotlight.  Both independent MPs, they helped to ensure Labor governed in a parliament where neither of the major parties could get a majority in their own right.  David Mark spends time with both men in their New South Wales electorates and in the hothouse of Parliament House in Canberra.  His documentary looks at how the politicians’ ideals have clashed with the reality of a particularly toxic parliament. Have they achieved what they set out to do? What do their constituents think and what’s in store for election year 2013?
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Simon Santow</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Wed, 26 Dec 2012 17:05:13 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-i-sit-in-middle/4434512</guid>
          <category>Government and Politics</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: Bee Mystery</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-bee-mystery/4426720</link>
          <dc:creator>Simon Santow</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Mon, 24 Dec 2012 17:10:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-bee-mystery/4426720</guid>
          </item>
    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: Homeless Crisis</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/homeless-crisis/4426672</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Lindy Kerin has spent six months getting to know three people who have struggled to overcome homelessness.  This documentary highlights an organisation in Western Sydney which aims to help people get their lives back on track.  Stories include a former heroin addicted sex worker, an Aboriginal man who used to live in a cave and a young mother who has escaped drugs and domestic violence
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Simon Santow</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Mon, 24 Dec 2012 06:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/homeless-crisis/4426672</guid>
          <category>Homelessness</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: Gay Surrogacy</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-gay-surrogacy/4425950</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Concerns are growing about the Queensland government's proposed changes to surrogacy laws. 
The LNP government plans to change surrogacy laws to exclude same sex couples and singles.  This year the Newman government has also amended civil unions legislation and cut funding to gay health groups.   The Queensland Law Society says the legislative changes are blatantly discriminatory and breach federal legislation.  Nance Haxton looks at changes that have gay parents worried about whether they have a future in the state.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Simon Santow</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Mon, 17 Dec 2012 06:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-gay-surrogacy/4425950</guid>
          <category>Pregnancy and Childbirth</category>
            <category>Laws</category>
            <category>Discrimination</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: Beyond Apsara</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-beyond-apsara/3744390</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              The influences of America and Korea might be prominent in popular culture but Cambodia has a small but growing contemporary arts movement of its own.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Liam Cochrane</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Mon, 02 Jan 2012 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-beyond-apsara/3744390</guid>
          <category>Contemporary Art</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: Needle Exchange</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-needle-exchange/3744376</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              The ACT Government is considering a plan to provide prisoners with clean drug injecting needles and syringes.
If the pilot program goes ahead it would be a first in Australia.
However, most prison officers are vehemently opposed and some are vowing to boycott any moves to trial prison needle and syringe programs.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Adrienne  Francis</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Sat, 31 Dec 2011 07:10:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-needle-exchange/3744376</guid>
          <category>Drug Use</category>
            <category>Prisons and Punishment</category>
            <category>Health Policy</category>
            </item>

          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: Poker Debate</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/poker-debate/3741474</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              A Radio Current Affairs documentary on the issue of problem gambling in Australian communities.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Michael Edwards</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Fri, 30 Dec 2011 17:10:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/poker-debate/3741474</guid>

          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: Teen Drinking</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-teen-drinking/3741664</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              With the party season upon us, it doesn't seem unusual to indulge in a little too much to drink.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Rebecca Barret</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Thu, 29 Dec 2011 17:10:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-teen-drinking/3741664</guid>

          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: Harold Holt</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-harold-holt/3744370</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              Reporter Brendan Trembath has searched through hundreds of documents and recordings to present this account of the disappearance of an Australian Prime Minister.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Brendan Trembath</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Wed, 28 Dec 2011 17:10:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-harold-holt/3744370</guid>

    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: Afghan War</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-afghan-war/3744364</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              32 of our soldiers have now died in Afghanistan since 2001 and 213 have been injured, a number of them, permanently.
The lives of so many more people have also been irrevocably changed as a result of the war.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Charlotte Glennie</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Tue, 27 Dec 2011 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-afghan-war/3744364</guid>

            <category>Army</category>
            </item>
    <item>
          <title>Radio Current Affairs Documentary: WA Commissioner</title>
          <link>http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-wa-commissioner/3744346</link>
          <description>
              <![CDATA[
              It's a call that every parent would dread - the news that their child has been badly burned in an illegal drug lab explosion, but  particularly when the parent receiving that call is a commissioner of police.
              ]]>
            </description>
          <dc:creator>Andrew O'Connor</dc:creator>
          <pubDate>Mon, 26 Dec 2011 17:05:00 +1100</pubDate>
          <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/currentaffairsspecials/radio-current-affairs-documentary3a-wa-commissioner/3744346</guid>

            <category>Drug Offences</category>

            </item>
